title: Bismillah Khan
summary: Bismillah Khan (Hindi: [bɪsmɪlːɑː xɑːn];born Qamaruddin Khan, 21 March 1914 – 21 August 2006), often referred to by the title Ustad, was an Indian musician credited with popularizing the shehnai, a reeded woodwind instrument. While the shehnai had long held importance as a folk instrument played primarily schooled in traditional ceremonies, Khan is credited with elevating its status and bringing it to the concert stage.[1][2]
